details: This is a powerful cardiac stimulant. As such in SYNCOPE, thrombosis, hemorrhage, snake-bites, chloroform narcosis, may be given by inhalation.The oedema and ulceration of mucous membranes produced by this powerful drug have been utilized as guiding symptoms for its use; hence in membranous croup with burning in oesophagus. Aphonia. See CAUSTICUM.

Respiratory: Accumulation of mucus with incessant coughing
Spasm of the glottis with suffocation; patient gasps for breath
Pain in oesophagus on breathing deeply
Scraping and burning in throat and oesophagus
Nasal diphtheria, with burning excoriating discharge

name: Ammonium causticum
dosage: First to third potency; also five to ten minims, well diluted with water.
